. It is the oldest city in the state.

value: According to legend, Nacogdoches was founded by one of two brothers, son of a Caddo chief who lived along the Sabine River. One day, he sent the brothers away, one of them three nights to the west, where he founded Nacogdoches, and the other three nights to the east, where he founded
. The spelling difference in the two is attributed to Spanish versus French transliteration.

After periodic settlement dating back 10,000 years, Nacogdoches first became a permanent village around 1300, settled by the mound-building Caddo people. After Europeans began exploring the area, Nacogdoches was an important trading post for French and Spanish pioneers. Permanent Spanish presence began here in 1716 with the establishment of a mission, and the city remained the most important city in East Texas for over a hundred years. In its history it has flown the flags of three abortive republics in addition to the six flags that have flown over the rest of Texas.

value: , now called North Street, runs through the center of town and is thought to be the oldest street in the United States, as it connected Nacogdoches with other Indian communities as many as 750 years ago.
content=An 1830's farmstead, blacksmith shop, and smokehouse. The house is the second-oldest extant structure in town. Free tours.

, Mounds at Hughes. Built in 1845, this is the only surviving structure of a university commisioned by the Republic of Texas. It now houses a museum with relics of the period.
, off US 59 just north of town. Believed to be the oldest union church in Texas. The present building was constructed in 1852.
on the Stephen F. Austin University campus. Reconstruction, using the original stones, of the Spanish fort built here in 1779.
, 211 S. Lanana. The oldest standing structure in town, constructed in 1830, once served as a meeting place for famous historical figures like Sam Houston and Davy Crockett. Free tours.

Nacogdoches has a lot of historic homes, many of which have been converted into bed and breakfast accommodations.
